N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 31.3 - Certificate showing additional vehicle or liability coverage

State Regulations

If such certificate is being filed to show that an
additional vehicle or liability coverage is being added to an already existing
policy, the policy period to be shown on the certificate should commence with
the date upon which the policy becomes effective as to such additional vehicle
or coverage. The period in which the certificate must be filed, as required by
section
31.2
of this Part, will commence
on the date upon which the policy becomes effective as to such additional
vehicle or coverage. Example: A has two cars, one insured in X Company under a policy
with a policy period from 7/1/64 to 7/1/65, the other in Y Company under a
policy with a policy period from 8/1/63 to 8/1/64. As of 8/1/64, the second
vehicle is added to the policy with X Company. The certificate of insurance to
be filed by X Company with respect to the additional car should show a policy
period from 8/1/64 to 7/1/65. Such certificate must be filed with the

Department of Motor Vehicles within 14 calendar days after
8/1/64. Notes
